newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates surge on market operation.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates surge on market operation.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates soared on Wednesday amid an open market operation by the State (central) Bank of Pakistan, dealers said.
The bank mopped up about five billion rupees in its weekly operation at a cut-off yield of 16 percent a year, a dealer at Standard Chartered Bank said.

As a result, the overnight market traded in the range of 14 to 19 percent and banks discounted about 1.3 billion rupees from the central bank, he said. A fund shortage is likely to persist on Thursday and keep the rates at higher levels.
